sentence.text: ` Afternoon , all , " said Jackie Tiptoe , leaning up against the cotton bale and grinning his sunniest grin .
He grinned his wide toothless grin at her and made his way unsteadily across the room to her side .
He was squatting at our feet grinning his wide sheepish grin .
He grinned his vulpine grin at her , and she smiled dutifully at his self-mockery .
Delighted to get some response at last , Lord Cumbermound grinned his evil grin .
As the roars of approval reverberated around the ground he grinned an uncomfortable grin , almost one of embarrassment .
Jamie grins his tired grin .
We grin at each other through forkfuls of spaghetti .
He grinned at her impishly .
The hand dropped from his shoulder , and Patrick glanced around , massaging his stiffened muscle , to see a broad , stout man grinning at him .
Benjamin , his wounded finger clasped in a wet rag , grinned from ear to ear .
She was grinning from ear to ear , her eyes sparkling in excited anticipation , like a child watching magicians at a carnival .
The faces grinning from the tatty punk regalia looked so depraved and hollow-eyed that I could not bear to think of my American blues friends calling them ` sir " .
Glancing up the American boy saw a peasant pole-carrier , who had skipped across the road close in front of the Citron , grinning triumphantly from a roadside ditch .
Dunbar was grinning in high content as he wheeled his horse to trot back to his own division .
Polly grinned in delight , revelling in a heart-swelling sense of power .
In the picture Stuart held , his father was grinning self-consciously in his formal dress , at least a head taller than his wife who hung on his arm , looking up and laughing at her husband .
He grinned in a more cheerful manner , then left the office .
He grins in recollection and there 's mischief in his eyes .
Harry grinned in relief and buried his head in the pillow to wipe off the sweat trickling from his brow .
` Smile , " he said , his voice indicating that he was certainly grinning like a Cheshire cat .
As Michael looked at the man sitting opposite , his fat ugly face grinning like a Cheshire cat 's , he felt an impulse to smash his fist into his teeth .
He grinned like a crocodile .
And she grinned to herself at the luxury of having someone in her life who would pay attention , who she could talk to .
Kelly grinned to herself .
Yanto grinned to himself .
Sooty turned to Yanto , who was already grinning with anticipation .
She grinned with him .
Tammuz grinned with pleasure .
Donald McCulloch grinned with pleasure and then turned it into a look of complicity for the younger men .
He grinned with triumph .
Jack grinned amiably into the camera .
She glanced upward and grinned weakly in spite of fraught nerves .
First , Chris sweet-talks a uniformed reception guard , who grins bashfully under the peak of his cap .
He looked up at me and grinned quickly before hunching over the controls again .
She grinned back slyly .
Polly grinned back confidently at him and thumped her tail .
He grinned , and the porter grinned back .
He glowered at his servant but Ranulf grinned back as he swayed slightly on his feet and looked around , admiring the church .
He grinned cheekily back .
Melissa grinned back at her .
Ross grinned back at her as he leaned forward , helping himself to another slice of chocolate cake .
His elder son grinned easily back at him .
Her milky eyes grinned slyly up at Athelstan .
The Doctor grinned up at Ace and Benny 's grime-streaked faces .
Rees grinned up at Wycliffe .
Jorge grinned up at Mitch with some relief .
He yelped as she bit him , but Leonora grinned up at him , unrepentant .
Jackie Tiptoe grinned down at him and winked .
Curtis sighed with regret , then grinned down at Grant and Pam .
Piers grinned down at her , his eyebrows raised .
Bernard Walton 's face grinned patronizingly down from the wall .
Beyond him rode the Lombard brothers grinning broadly and enjoying themselves .
He swung his legs off the bed , grinning broadly , and started for the door .
When Edward suggested ablutions first he grinned engagingly and led him to the bar .
Three of them moved forward , swords unsheathed , while the fourth held their horses , grinning evilly and calling encouragement to his fellows .
He is grinning madly , clearly moved by the occasion .
Alex grinned mightily , so proud of her he seemed about to explode .
Miles grinned rather foolishly .
But I was grinning too .
Lucenzo muttered something to the man , who grinned understandingly .
Forster grinned , exposing teeth tipped with gold .
He grinned and nodded .
Sid grinned and said : ` You came up that last bit at a fair lick . "
He grinned , tried to take the sting out of his words .
Benjamin grinned and linked his arm through mine .
He regarded Lucy reflectively , then grinned as he said , ` It 's just as well you did n't come downstairs in that tell-tale state . "
